title: Chicken-Fried Steak with Wasabi-Joyu (Gyukatsu)
ingredients: One 1-pound boneless rib-eye steak (about 1″ thick), rested at room temperature for 30 minutes
directions: Trim any large chunks of fat from the steak. Slice on the bias into four pieces about 1″ thick. Cover each with plastic wrap and lightly pound to a uniform ¾″ thickness.
Set up three shallow trays with flour, beaten egg, and panko. Coat each steak piece in flour (shake off excess), dip in egg, then press into panko. Transfer to a plate.

Pour about ⅓″ vegetable oil into a heavy skillet and heat to 350 °F. (Test by dropping in a few panko crumbs—if they sizzle and brown immediately, it’s ready.) Line a baking sheet with paper towels or a wire rack.
Fry cutlets in batches until the exterior is golden and crisp but the interior remains rare, about 30 seconds per side. Transfer to the prepared tray to drain.
For each serving, mix about ½ tsp wasabi into 1 Tbsp soy sauce. Slice cutlets into strips and serve alongside cabbage and wasabi-joyu.
